verses.verse: Then Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Therefore <S%H3651><s%> my disquieting <S%H9620><s%> thoughts <S%H9620><s%> make me respond, <S%H7725><s%> Even because <S%H5668><s%> of my inward agitation. <S%H2363><s%>
"I listened <S%H8085><s%> to the reproof <S%H4148><s%> which insults <S%H3639><s%> me, And the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of my understanding <S%H998><s%> makes me answer. <S%H6030><s%>
"Do you know <S%H3045><s%> this <S%H384><s%> from of old, <S%H5703><s%> From the establishment <S%H7760><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> on earth, <S%H776><s%>
That the triumphing <S%H7445><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is short, <S%H7138><s%> And the joy <S%H8057><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> momentary <S%H5704><s%> <S%H7281><s%>?
"Though <S%H518><s%> his loftiness <S%H7863><s%> reaches <S%H5927><s%> the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> And his head <S%H7218><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> the clouds, <S%H5645><s%>
He perishes forever <S%H6><s%> like his refuse; <S%H5331><s%> Those who have seen <S%H1561><s%> him will say, <S%H7200><s%> 'Where <S%H559><s%> is he?'

"He flies <S%H5774><s%> away <S%H5774><s%> like a dream, <S%H2472><s%> and they cannot <S%H3808><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> him; Even like a vision <S%H2384><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%> he is chased <S%H5074><s%> away. <S%H5074><s%>
"The eye <S%H5869><s%> which saw <S%H7805><s%> him sees him no <S%H3808><s%> more, <S%H3254><s%> And his place <S%H4725><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> longer <S%H5750><s%> beholds <S%H7789><s%> him.
"His sons <S%H1121><s%> favor <S%H7521><s%> the poor, <S%H1800><s%> And his hands <S%H3027><s%> give <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> his wealth. <S%H202><s%>
"His bones <S%H6106><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of his youthful <S%H5934><s%> vigor, <S%H5934><s%> But it lies <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> with him in the dust. <S%H6083><s%>
"Though <S%H518><s%> evil <S%H9567><s%> is sweet <S%H4985><s%> in his mouth, <S%H6310><s%> [And] he hides <S%H3582><s%> it under <S%H8478><s%> his tongue, <S%H3956><s%>
[Though] he desires <S%H2550><s%> it and will not let <S%H5800><s%> it go, <S%H5800><s%> But holds <S%H4513><s%> it in his mouth, <S%H2441><s%>
[Yet] his food <S%H3899><s%> in his stomach <S%H4578><s%> is changed <S%H2015><s%> To the venom <S%H4846><s%> of cobras <S%H6620><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> him.
"He swallows <S%H1104><s%> riches, <S%H2428><s%> But will vomit <S%H9513><s%> them up; God <S%H410><s%> will expel <S%H3423><s%> them from his belly. <S%H990><s%>
"He sucks <S%H3243><s%> the poison <S%H7219><s%> of cobras; <S%H6620><s%> The viper's tongue <S%H3956><s%> slays <S%H2026><s%> him.
"He does not look <S%H7200><s%> at the streams, <S%H6390><s%> The rivers <S%H5104><s%> flowing <S%H5158><s%> with honey <S%H1706><s%> and curds. <S%H2529><s%>

"He returns <S%H7725><s%> what <S%H3022><s%> he has attained <S%H3022><s%> And cannot <S%H3808><s%> swallow <S%H1104><s%> [it;] As to the riches <S%H2428><s%> of his trading, <S%H8545><s%> He cannot <S%H3808><s%> even enjoy <S%H5965><s%> [them.]
"For he has oppressed <S%H7533><s%> [and] forsaken <S%H5800><s%> the poor; <S%H1800><s%> He has seized <S%H1497><s%> a house <S%H1004><s%> which he has not built. <S%H1129><s%>
"Because <S%H3588><s%> he knew <S%H3045><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> quiet <S%H7961><s%> within <S%H990><s%> him He does not retain <S%H4422><s%> anything he desires. <S%H2530><s%>
"Nothing <S%H369><s%> remains <S%H8300><s%> for him to devour, <S%H398><s%> Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> his prosperity <S%H2898><s%> does not endure. <S%H2342><s%>

"In the fulness <S%H4390><s%> of his plenty <S%H8231><s%> he will be cramped; <S%H9503><s%> The hand <S%H3027><s%> of everyone <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H9416><s%> suffers <S%H9416><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> [against] him.

"When he fills <S%H4390><s%> his belly, <S%H990><s%> [God] will send <S%H7971><s%> His fierce <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> on him And will rain <S%H4305><s%> [it] on him while he is eating. <S%H3894><s%>
"He may flee <S%H1272><s%> from the iron <S%H1270><s%> weapon, <S%H5402><s%> [But] the bronze <S%H5154><s%> bow <S%H7198><s%> will pierce <S%H2498><s%> him.

"It is drawn <S%H8025><s%> forth <S%H8025><s%> and comes <S%H3318><s%> out of his back, <S%H1465><s%> Even the glittering <S%H1300><s%> point <S%H1300><s%> from his gall. <S%H4845><s%> Terrors <S%H367><s%> come <S%H1980><s%> upon him,

Complete <S%H3605><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> is held <S%H2934><s%> in reserve <S%H2934><s%> for his treasures, <S%H6845><s%> And unfanned <S%H5301><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> will devour <S%H398><s%> him; It will consume <S%H7462><s%> the survivor <S%H8300><s%> in his tent. <S%H168><s%>
"The heavens <S%H8064><s%> will reveal <S%H1540><s%> his iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> And the earth <S%H776><s%> will rise <S%H6965><s%> up against him.
"The increase <S%H2981><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> will depart; <S%H1540><s%> [His possessions] will flow <S%H5064><s%> away in the day <S%H3117><s%> of His anger. <S%H639><s%>
"This <S%H2088><s%> is the wicked <S%H7563><s%> man's portion <S%H2506><s%> from God, <S%H430><s%> Even the heritage <S%H5159><s%> decreed <S%H561><s%> to him by God. <S%H410><s%>"
